snippet: Hospital pricing is often convoluted, and hospital charges represent about a third of the total United States health care bill.
abstract: Economists say that in medical system notorious for opaque finances and inflated bills, nothing is more convoluted than hospital pricing; Journal of the American Medical Assn study finds hospital charges represent about a third of the $2.7 trillion annual health care bill in United States, biggest single segment, and largest driver of medical inflation (Series: Paying Till It Hurts).

byline.contributor: Jo Craven McGinty contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Hospital pricing is often convoluted, and hospital charges represent about a third of the total United States health care bill.
